All ships are welcome here, so long as they have fewer than 500 fics on AO3.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Another reason to ship Sansan: Arya would be the worst/best sister in law to Sandor. In barbecue meetings, she'd ask Sansa "What...
body: Another reason to ship Sansan: Arya would be the worst/best sister in law to Sandor. In barbecue meetings, she’d ask Sansa “What did you even see in that guy?” then slap him in the butt and tell him to move over the grill because he can’t cook for shit. He would called her a brat and they would fight for the fork while Sansa rolls her eyes.

reblog.comment: Another reason to ship Sansan: Arya would be the worst/best sister in law to Sandor. In barbecue meetings, she’d ask Sansa “What did you even see in that guy?” then slap him in the butt and tell him to move over the grill because he can’t cook for shit. He would called her a brat and they would fight for the fork while Sansa rolls her eyes.

trail.content_raw: Another reason to ship Sansan: Arya would be the worst/best sister in law to Sandor. In barbecue meetings, she’d ask Sansa “What did you even see in that guy?” then slap him in the butt and tell him to move over the grill because he can’t cook for shit. He would called her a brat and they would fight for the fork while Sansa rolls her eyes.
trail.content: Another reason to ship Sansan: Arya would be the worst/best sister in law to Sandor. In barbecue meetings, she’d ask Sansa “What did you even see in that guy?” then slap him in the butt and tell him to move over the grill because he can’t cook for shit. He would called her a brat and they would fight for the fork while Sansa rolls her eyes.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary:
Inktober Catch Up Part 2! Another process video, this time of this image.
These two are Sansa and Arya from my Staying Together...
body:
Inktober Catch Up Part 2! Another process video, this time of this image.

These two are Sansa and Arya from my Staying Together AU, where they have to work as small folk. Day 5 of the Inktober Prompts was “chicken”, so here’s Sansa feeding and distracting the chickens while Arya gets the eggs.

reblog.comment:

tags: you guys sick of this shit yet?
too bad i have several more archetype/symbolism books on my to read list lol
summary:
more on arya stark + “goddesses in every woman” by jean shinoda bolen: 



It helps to realize that death and rebirth, in myth...
body:
more on arya stark + “goddesses in every woman” by jean shinoda bolen:

It helps to realize that death and rebirth, in myth and dreams, are metaphors for loss, depression, and recovery. In retrospect, many such dark periods turn out to be rites of passage, a time of suffering through which a woman has learned something of value, and has grown.

this is the way arya’s arc should be viewed but never is. people get caught up in the assassin aspect and the show is downright gimmicky (empty) about it but the whole storyline is literally a struggle to overcome depression and trauma. when experiencing loss it can feel like losing yourself or as if you’re gone. as if you’re no one without those you cared for. thats what arya is going through. thats what the “no one” and faces thing in the hob&w truly represents. she is at risk of losing herself to grief. when she lost her family and home she feels as if she died too. she’s in so much pain. but arya will be reborn. she can recover and heal and grow. 

Similarly, the heroine’s journey is an individuation quest. Traveling this path, the heroine may find, lose, and rediscover what has meaning to her, until she holds on to these values in all kinds of circumstances that test her. She may repeatedly encounter whatever threatens to overcome her, until finally the danger of losing her selfhood is over.

what has meaning to arya is her pack. she was set on that path early in her story when ned told her “the lone wolf dies but the pack survives” but then she lost her pack as she was thrown out into the world without them. then she found it again in gendry and hot pie. only to lose it again when they left. and lose it again and again when her entire family was (seemingly) killed. which “threatens to overcome her” and endangers arya’s “selfhood” but eventually she will find her pack and herself and nothing will be able to take either from her. 

Note that after proving her courage and competency, the heroine does not go riding off into the sunset by herself, like the archetypal cowboy hero. Nor is she cast in the mold of the conquering hero. Union, reunion, and home are where her journey ends.

i almost screamed when i read this lol. if everyone would look back at what ive been preaching! arya’s journey will not end with her alone and cast off. she has struggled too hard against that. in the end she will find the identity, family, and home that she’s been looking for.

summary: This is a monster. An unfinished one. I originally started this as a cyberpunk ciri image with ciri, the bike and warehouse. I...
caption:
This is a monster. An unfinished one. I originally started this as a cyberpunk ciri image with ciri, the bike and warehouse. I then added the androids since I’ve had the figure for while and never used it. Then I started adding in more figures that I’ve for a total of twelve.
The problem I started having was beside taking forever to load, is that I can’t get it to render in Iray. I started this in late July, it was was mostly done by mid August. Either Daz shuts down or my laptop reboots when I try.
This was rendered in 3ds and the fact that it rendered at all is shocking. It seem 12 figures and props are the limit for now. The scene is saved and I try again at a latter date.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: The Northern Lords on the show are useless whiny idiotic shitheads
When will we see the bad-ass lords from the books?
summary:
At the end of the day, when Jon goes back to the North, the
people who truly respect and love him will be on his side and...
body:
At the end of the day, when Jon goes back to the North, the people who truly respect and love him will be on his side and understand that he made the right decision. These people include:

Arya, who was ready to chop off some heads because the lords were insulting Jon and talking treason.

Bran, who truly understands the gravity of the threat and what’s needed to defeat the WW.

The Wildlings who have fought and died for Jon and are loyal to him.

Lyanna Mormont who gave her 62 men to fight in the BOTB because her father thought Jon was the best man to fight the WW

Anyone else? If the likes of Glover - treasonous weather vanes - want to kick Jon out because he bend the knee, they can come up with their own way to defeat the WW. Glover had no issues with the Boltons as wardens of the North answering to the Lannisters of KL. But suddenly, when Dany comes to save them, Northern independence would be more important than an apocalyptic threat?

If they start talking bs, Jon should let them make Sansa QITN, ask them to deal with the WW on their own and peace out with Dany, Arya, Bran and Ghost. But he’s too good for that. So we will have to once again sit through Jon tiredly dealing with a bunch of naysayers shitting all over his plans.

It’s also hilarious how rabid Stark/Sansa fans go on and on about Northern independence and Dany not respecting their rights. They should ask Theon Greyjoy about how he felt being a child hostage in Winterfell because his father wanted independence for the Iron Islands. So it’s all okay for Ned Stark to attack the Iron Islands because they dared to fight for independence, but everyone should respect the North’s right to independence? This hypocrisy and double standards are what is typical of the Stark fandom. It’s one rule for the Starks and another for everyone else.

Hopefully Northern shitheads like Glover have enough brain cells to realize that they need Dany’s help and band together to defeat the common threat rather than bitch and whine about Jon doing the needful.

blog.name: theladymeera
blog.title: I'm So Salty I'm a Pickle
blog.description:
Daenerys was my first fave and she will be my last.

Danielle, US. Meera is the frog queen of my heart but I post more about my dragon queen Dany. Trying to be a happy person against the will of all these nihilistic men.

This is my ASOIAF/GOT side blog. My main is a-mountain-girl, my booklr is readingaway.

summary: Arya, about the latest guy who wants to date her: This guy's fine, I knew a million guys like him in college, trust me. He's...
body: Arya, about the latest guy who wants to date her: This guy's fine, I knew a million guys like him in college, trust me. He's into all this now and then he'll see me eating a piece of ham off the ground and he'll move on.

blog.name: don56
blog.title: heroesandlegacies
blog.description: I like movies, television, pulp magazines, sailing, science fiction and mystery novels and fumetti. I collect movie posters, lobby cards and screen used props.

blog.name: sketchasoiaf
blog.title: A Sketch of Ice and Fire
blog.description:
My name is Noa and I'm re-reading and drawing each chapter of a Song of Ice and Fire. Updated 3 times a week.

Contact me at noa@null.co.il | Main art tumblr: http://noalp.tumblr.com | My Patreon

View by Character POV: Jon | Tyrion | Daenerys | Ned | Catelyn | Arya | Sansa | Bran | Theon | Davos | Jaime

I'm Diana.
Books and movies are my obsession.
TV shows and beauty my addiction.
Writing and traveling my passion.
Food and laughter my god.
Welcome to my consciousness.
